rrr
  • Reference
  • Articles

Residuals of Reduced-Rank Regression

rrr_residual calculates residuals of a reduced-rank regression model.

rrr_residual(x, y, gamma_matrix, rank = "full", type = "cov", k = 0)

Arguments

x
data frame or matrix of predictor variables
y
data frame or matrix of response variables
gamma_matrix
weight matrix
rank
of the coefficient matrix to estimate. Default rank = full prodcues the standard multivariate regression technique.
type
the format of the covariance matrix. type = "cov" runs the regression using the mean-centered covariance matrix. type = "cor" runs the regression using the mean-centered, standard-deviation-scaled correlation matrix.
k
small constant to add to the ridge of covariance matrices to avoid singularity.

Value

data frame of residuals.

References

Izenman, A.J. (2008) Modern Multivariate Statistical Techniques. Springer.

Examples

data(tobacco)
tobacco_x <- tobacco[,4:9]
tobacco_y <- tobacco[,1:3]
gamma <- diag(1, dim(tobacco_y)[2])
tobacco_rrr <- rrr(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma, rank = 1)
rrr_residual(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma, rank = 1)
#> # A tibble: 25 × 3
#>    Y1.BurnRate Y2.PercentSugar Y3.PercentNicotine
#>          <dbl>           <dbl>              <dbl>

#> 6  -0.04949370       0.3195653         -1.2428487
